snippet: Most religious institutions are better at collecting money than they used to be, by accepting donations via credit card or electronically pulling money from people’s bank accounts.
abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column says that most religious institutions are better at collecting money than they used to be, using technology to their advantage, accepting donations via credit card or electronically pulling money from people’s bank accounts.
